verses.verse: And the Ziphites<WH2130> came<WH935> unto Saul<WH7586> to Gibeah<WH1390>, saying<WH559>, Doth not David<WH1732> hide<WH5641> himself in the hill<WH1389> of Hachilah<WH2444>, which is before<WH6440> Jeshimon<WH3452>?

Then Saul<WH7586> arose<WH6965>, and went down<WH3381> to the wilderness<WH4057> of Ziph<WH2128>, having three<WH7969> thousand<WH505> chosen<WH977> men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> with him, to seek<WH1245> David<WH1732> in the wilderness<WH4057> of Ziph<WH2128>.

And Saul<WH7586> pitched<WH2583> in the hill<WH1389> of Hachilah<WH2444>, which is before<WH6440> Jeshimon<WH3452>, by the way<WH1870>. But David<WH1732> abode<WH3427> in the wilderness<WH4057>, and he saw<WH7200> that Saul<WH7586> came<WH935> after<WH310> him into the wilderness<WH4057>.
David<WH1732> therefore sent out<WH7971> spies<WH7270>, and understood<WH3045> that Saul<WH7586> was come<WH935> in very deed<WH3559>.

And David<WH1732> arose<WH6965>, and came<WH935> to the place<WH4725> where Saul<WH7586> had pitched<WH2583>: and David<WH1732> beheld<WH7200> the place<WH4725> where Saul<WH7586> lay<WH7901>, and Abner<WH74> the son<WH1121> of Ner<WH5369>, the captain<WH8269> of his host<WH6635>: and Saul<WH7586> lay<WH7901> in the trench<WH4570>, and the people<WH5971> pitched<WH2583> round about<WH5439> him. trench: or, midst of his carriages

Then answered<WH6030> David<WH1732> and said<WH559> to Ahimelech<WH288> the Hittite<WH2850>, and to Abishai<WH52> the son<WH1121> of Zeruiah<WH6870>, brother<WH251> to Joab<WH3097>, saying<WH559>, Who will go down<WH3381> with me to Saul<WH7586> to the camp<WH4264>? And Abishai<WH52> said<WH559>, I will go down<WH3381> with thee.

So David<WH1732> and Abishai<WH52> came<WH935> to the people<WH5971> by night<WH3915>: and, behold, Saul<WH7586> lay<WH7901> sleeping<WH3463> within the trench<WH4570>, and his spear<WH2595> stuck<WH4600> in the ground<WH776> at his bolster<WH4763>: but Abner<WH74> and the people<WH5971> lay<WH7901> round about<WH5439> him.

Then said<WH559> Abishai<WH52> to David<WH1732>, God<WH430> hath delivered<WH5462> thine enemy<WH341> into thine hand<WH3027> this day<WH3117>: now therefore let me smite<WH5221> him, I pray thee, with the spear<WH2595> even to the earth<WH776> at once<WH6471> <WH259>, and I will not smite him the second time<WH8138>. delivered: Heb. shut up
And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Abishai<WH52>, Destroy<WH7843> him not: for who can stretch forth<WH7971> his hand<WH3027> against the LORD'S<WH3068> anointed<WH4899>, and be guiltless<WH5352>?

David<WH1732> said<WH559> furthermore, As the LORD<WH3068> liveth<WH2416>, the LORD<WH3068> shall smite<WH5062> him; or his day<WH3117> shall come<WH935> to die<WH4191>; or he shall descend<WH3381> into battle<WH4421>, and perish<WH5595>.

The LORD<WH3068> forbid<WH2486> that I should stretch forth<WH7971> mine hand<WH3027> against the LORD'S<WH3068> anointed<WH4899>: but, I pray thee, take<WH3947> thou now the spear<WH2595> that is at his bolster<WH4763>, and the cruse<WH6835> of water<WH4325>, and let us go<WH3212>.

So David<WH1732> took<WH3947> the spear<WH2595> and the cruse<WH6835> of water<WH4325> from Saul's<WH7586> bolster<WH7226>; and they gat them away<WH3212>, and no man saw<WH7200> it, nor knew<WH3045> it, neither awaked<WH6974>: for they were all asleep<WH3463>; because a deep sleep<WH8639> from the LORD<WH3068> was fallen<WH5307> upon them.
Then David<WH1732> went over<WH5674> to the other side<WH5676>, and stood<WH5975> on the top<WH7218> of an hill<WH2022> afar off<WH7350>; a great<WH7227> space<WH4725> being between them:

And David<WH1732> cried<WH7121> to the people<WH5971>, and to Abner<WH74> the son<WH1121> of Ner<WH5369>, saying<WH559>, Answerest<WH6030> thou not, Abner<WH74>? Then Abner<WH74> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>, Who art thou that criest<WH7121> to the king<WH4428>?

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Abner<WH74>, Art not thou a valiant man<WH376>? and who is like to thee in Israel<WH3478>? wherefore then hast thou not kept<WH8104> thy lord<WH113> the king<WH4428>? for there came<WH935> one<WH259> of the people<WH5971> in to destroy<WH7843> the king<WH4428> thy lord<WH113>.

This thing<WH1697> is not good<WH2896> that thou hast done<WH6213>. As the LORD<WH3068> liveth<WH2416>, ye are worthy<WH1121> to die<WH4194>, because ye have not kept<WH8104> your master<WH113>, the LORD'S<WH3068> anointed<WH4899>. And now see<WH7200> where the king's<WH4428> spear<WH2595> is, and the cruse<WH6835> of water<WH4325> that was at his bolster<WH4763>. worthy to die: Heb. the sons of death

And Saul<WH7586> knew<WH5234> David's<WH1732> voice<WH6963>, and said<WH559>, Is this thy voice<WH6963>, my son<WH1121> David<WH1732>? And David<WH1732> said<WH559>, It is my voice<WH6963>, my lord<WH113>, O king<WH4428>.
And he said<WH559>, Wherefore doth my lord<WH113> thus pursue<WH7291> after<WH310> his servant<WH5650>? for what have I done<WH6213>? or what evil<WH7451> is in mine hand<WH3027>?

Now therefore, I pray thee, let my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> hear<WH8085> the words<WH1697> of his servant<WH5650>. If the LORD<WH3068> have stirred thee up<WH5496> against me, let him accept<WH7306> an offering<WH4503>: but if they be the children<WH1121> of men<WH120>, cursed<WH779> be they before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068>; for they have driven<WH1644> me out this day<WH3117> from abiding<WH5596> in the inheritance<WH5159> of the LORD<WH3068>, saying<WH559>, Go<WH3212>, serve<WH5647> other<WH312> gods<WH430>. accept: Heb. smell abiding: Heb. cleaving

Now therefore, let not my blood<WH1818> fall<WH5307> to the earth<WH776> before the face<WH6440> of the LORD<WH3068>: for the king<WH4428> of Israel<WH3478> is come out<WH3318> to seek<WH1245> a<WH259> flea<WH6550>, as when one doth hunt<WH7291> a partridge<WH7124> in the mountains<WH2022>.

Then said<WH559> Saul<WH7586>, I have sinned<WH2398>: return<WH7725>, my son<WH1121> David<WH1732>: for I will no more do thee harm<WH7489>, because my soul<WH5315> was precious<WH3365> in thine eyes<WH5869> this day<WH3117>: behold, I have played the fool<WH5528>, and have erred<WH7686> exceedingly<WH7235> <WH3966>.
And David<WH1732> answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>, Behold the king's<WH4428> spear<WH2595>! and let one<WH259> of the young men<WH5288> come over<WH5674> and fetch<WH3947> it.

The LORD<WH3068> render<WH7725> to every man<WH376> his righteousness<WH6666> and his faithfulness<WH530>: for the LORD<WH3068> delivered<WH5414> thee into my hand<WH3027> to day<WH3117>, but I would<WH14> not stretch forth<WH7971> mine hand<WH3027> against the LORD'S<WH3068> anointed<WH4899>.

And, behold, as thy life<WH5315> was much set by<WH1431> this day<WH3117> in mine eyes<WH5869>, so let my life<WH5315> be much set by<WH1431> in the eyes<WH5869> of the LORD<WH3068>, and let him deliver<WH5337> me out of all tribulation<WH6869>.

Then Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> to David<WH1732>, Blessed<WH1288> be thou, my son<WH1121> David<WH1732>: thou shalt both do<WH6213> great<WH6213> things, and also shalt still<WH3201> prevail<WH3201>. So David<WH1732> went<WH3212> on his way<WH1870>, and Saul<WH7586> returned<WH7725> to his place<WH4725>.
